body:
The main account isn't banned, right? Or throttled/shadowbanned in any way?

I can see why making multiple accounts to circumvent per-user limitations is a pretty bad violation, or should be. It's not like having a throwaway and a highly-identifying account separately. Voting rings should be a bad violation as well, the site won't work if that stuff is allowed and a number of users just go wild at that.
body_html:
The main account isn't banned, right? Or throttled/shadowbanned in any way?

Voting rings should be a bad violation as well, the site won't work if that stuff is allowed and a number of users just go wild at that.

post.title: Lmao I am literally such a huge deal that one of the admins' pet discord trannies already leapt on my guild 🤣👍🏻

body:
>The reason for the ban is that you had 69 (no laughing) guilds between you and your dozen or so alt accounts. Using multiple accounts to circumvent per-user limitations is something we consider to be breaking Ruqqus.

Are you able to provide any context for how this “breaks Ruqqus?”

There would’ve been other more transparent ways to deal with this issue. As it stands, it looks as though you’ve taken action that has allowed a group of users you favour to take over the guilds of another user they are ideologically opposed to. 

>The First Amendment does not grant the right of free speech. Rather, it prevents the government from violating the pre-existing human right to free speech which is granted by God or Nature. This is an important distinction: **you have a basic human right to free speech even if you don't live in the United States.**

People have come here because this is what you say you stand for. Either you believe it or you don’t - there’s no middle ground.
body_html:
The reason for the ban is that you had 69 (no laughing) guilds between you and your dozen or so alt accounts. Using multiple accounts to circumvent per-user limitations is something we consider to be breaking Ruqqus.

Are you able to provide any context for how this “breaks Ruqqus?”

There would’ve been other more transparent ways to deal with this issue. As it stands, it looks as though you’ve taken action that has allowed a group of users you favour to take over the guilds of another user they are ideologically opposed to.

The First Amendment does not grant the right of free speech. Rather, it prevents the government from violating the pre-existing human right to free speech which is granted by God or Nature. This is an important distinction: you have a basic human right to free speech even if you don't live in the United States.

People have come here because this is what you say you stand for. Either you believe it or you don’t - there’s no middle ground.

post.title: Lmao I am literally such a huge deal that one of the admins' pet discord trannies already leapt on my guild 🤣👍🏻

body:
It isn't that action was taken, it's the manner in which it was taken that is the issue. That it was done under an ill defined policy "breaking Ruqqus" isn't great either. 

>There would’ve been other more transparent ways to deal with this issue.

Obvious to all - which is why it doesn't look good.

>As it stands, it looks as though you’ve taken action that has allowed a group of users you favour to take over the guilds of another user they are ideologically opposed to.

This is why it really doesn't look good - at all. Doesn't exactly inspire confidence, especially at a time when Ruqqus is trying to raise funds through promoting Premium memberships to users. 

Confidence isn't even the heart of it...

>Either you believe it or you don’t - there’s no middle ground.

Honour vs dishonourable action - who would follow those that engage in the latter.
body_html:
It isn't that action was taken, it's the manner in which it was taken that is the issue. That it was done under an ill defined policy "breaking Ruqqus" isn't great either.

There would’ve been other more transparent ways to deal with this issue.

Obvious to all - which is why it doesn't look good.

As it stands, it looks as though you’ve taken action that has allowed a group of users you favour to take over the guilds of another user they are ideologically opposed to.

This is why it really doesn't look good - at all. Doesn't exactly inspire confidence, especially at a time when Ruqqus is trying to raise funds through promoting Premium memberships to users.

Confidence isn't even the heart of it...

Either you believe it or you don’t - there’s no middle ground.

Honour vs dishonourable action - who would follow those that engage in the latter.

body:
The main account was banned for 7 days.

I agree with you that the rule should exist. I agree with you that it's probably a pretty bad violation. What I do have a problem with is the admins banning users for rules that don't exist yet.

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>
body_html:
The main account was banned for 7 days.

I agree with you that the rule should exist. I agree with you that it's probably a pretty bad violation. What I do have a problem with is the admins banning users for rules that don't exist yet.

- sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, don't censor my username]

parent.body:
The main account isn't banned, right? Or throttled/shadowbanned in any way?

I can see why making multiple accounts to circumvent per-user limitations is a pretty bad violation, or should be. It's not like having a throwaway and a highly-identifying account separately. Voting rings should be a bad violation as well, the site won't work if that stuff is allowed and a number of users just go wild at that.
parent.body_html:
The main account isn't banned, right? Or throttled/shadowbanned in any way?

I can see why making multiple accounts to circumvent per-user limitations is a pretty bad violation, or should be. It's not like having a throwaway and a highly-identifying account separately. Voting rings should be a bad violation as well, the site won't work if that stuff is allowed and a number of users just go wild at that.

body:
So you didn't find it odd that there was a 10 Guild limit as one of the main selling points (to prevent cancermods, which this guy was), and that Ruqqus prevented you from GMing more than 10 guilds pretty obviously wasn't enough? Seriously so you're telling me someone could see this message and the disabled "Create guild" button and think that it was OK to create alts to get around it?


![](https://i.ruqqus.com/comment/i2w0/gcZH2TuWepg)
